name: places/ChIJH7wCcfpYwokRuM8muD-Xw1M
formattedAddress: 410 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 410 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Whimsical boutique specializing in ceramics & enamelware, plus other upscale home decor & gifts.

originalText.text: We’re not from the US so I had been excited all day to visit this store and get gifts for Christmas. The staff are completely useless and seemed to avoid us after we had to ask three times for prices as half the stock aren’t priced. Staff having headphones in and chatting with friends - ridiculous for a store like this. We were told by Susan that some candles were half off and fit our budget with another item. She proceeded to charge us the full amount and claimed to ‘forget’ to give us our change. We had to ask twice. We were overcharged and when confronted, she simply said it wasn’t her problem. I don’t even know if the right items were packed for us to take home (going by other reviews here). Double check everything and make them pack it in front of you!! Shame on you guys.

I don’t even know if the right items were packed for us to take home (going by other reviews here). Double check everything and make them pack it in front of you!! Shame on you guys.

originalText.text: Really unhappy with my last purchase at the store. I picked a few fall items that were on sale, and left it at the store overnight to pick it up the following day. After I got the items home the following day, I discovered that one of them had been damaged either as it was being wrapped, or overnight when it was stored. Regardless, I loved the item too much, it was the last peace available anywhere l, so I kept it, but the underhandedness of the staff is quite disheartening.

text.text: Really unhappy with my last purchase at the store. I picked a few fall items that were on sale, and left it at the store overnight to pick it up the following day. After I got the items home the following day, I discovered that one of them had been damaged either as it was being wrapped, or overnight when it was stored. Regardless, I loved the item too much, it was the last peace available anywhere l, so I kept it, but the underhandedness of the staff is quite disheartening.

originalText.text:
The store was so beautiful when we visited NYC during Christmas. My son asked them if their dishes are Safe for eating food in. They assured us that they are FDA approved. He bought me four courtly check bowls. As you know they are quite expensive so they were Christmas present for me from my son.
I recently started using them for serving salad and guacamole.
After washing by hand (they are not dishwasher safe) , as I was drying them my towels turned black. I then realized that the bowls are smearing off black paint.
I would not serve food in these bowls as they are UNSAFE. I called the store and also Mackenzie Childs corporate office but nobody accepted any responsibility for these defective expensive bowls.
Do not buy and Do not use for serving food.
I am extremely disappointed.

originalText.text: The person (not from “here”) who gave a 1 star review below is a cry baby. The employees here are top notch. Went to the store today (I am from here), and yea the employees are sometimes on the phone (clearly the business phone answering customer calls as they simultaneously work the floors). The photo of the employee on the phone was working today- he’s a gem! Knows the business and how to work with a wideeeeee range of varied customers- top notch service, poise, and charm. We are happy customers!

originalText.text: My daughter and I visited the SoHo store today and the people there were lovely—until they weren’t. We had been helped by the nicest lady who appeared to be busy when a gentleman asked if we wanted to place our items behind the counter and we did. The lady then became quite irritated, made a rude comment that could be heard from a distance,  and stomped away. When I apologized (why am I apologizing?!?), she said,  “I’ve been helping you the entire time!”  So don’t confuse kindness with commission-based sales people.  She might be reminded that I could have purchased on line (probably finding it cheaper) or at my local retailer, knowing I would have helped a small business.
